FuncDef:
The aps signal-low-priority command specifies the low-priority signal failure code for a switching request carried in the K byte to be sent by an LMSP protection interface.
The undo aps signal-low-priority command restores the default high-priority code.
By default, an LMSP protect interface sends a high-priority signal failure code for a switching request carried in the K byte.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An LMSP protection interface uses the K type in an LMSP packet to negotiate with the LMSP protection interface on the remote end. By default, the high-priority signal failure code for a switching request is used. If the low-priority code is used on the LMSP protection interface on the remote end, the high-priority code on the LMSP protection interface on the local end must be changed to the low-priority code using the aps signal-low-priority command.
Prerequisites
Before you configure an interface as the protection interface of an LMSP group, add the interface to the LMSP group.
Precautions
The aps signal-low-priority command is run only on an LMSP protect interface. The priority of the code for a switching request on protect interfaces of both ends must be the same.
